dialogue_metadata.inferred_relationship: Colleagues or friends debating economic news

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, are we really, um, seeing this amazing economic recovery or what? I mean, look at P&G, shares are at an all-time high!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, are we really, um, seeing this amazing economic recovery or what? I mean, look at P&G, shares are at an all-time high!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The coronavirus pandemic has been a boon for stocks in software, biotech and consumer staples (think: Procter & Gamble, whose shares are at an all-time high and up 17% just this year), but its been terrible to a bevy of firms reporting this week, particularly in the banking and airline spaces.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Amazing? Are you serious? JPMorgan Chase is down nearly 28% this year! That’s, like, a total disaster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Amazing? Are you serious? JPMorgan Chase is down nearly twenty eight percent this year! That's, like, a total disaster.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JPMorgan, the nations biggest bank, led by Jamie Dimon, reports tomorrow and has seen shares plummet nearly 28% this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but Goldman Sachs is saying there’s a 60% chance we'll have a vaccine for 50 million Americans by early next year. That's huge!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but Goldman Sachs is saying there's a sixty percent chance we'll have a vaccine for fifty million Americans by early next year. That's huge!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Goldman believes theres a 48% chance that there will be enough doses of an FDA-approved coronavirus vaccine to treat 25 million Americans by the second or third quarters, the most likely time lines, followed closely by 42% odds that this will happen by the first quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A chance? And only 50 million? Glenmede doesn't expect earnings will reach new highs until the second half of 2021. That’s a year away, if we're lucky.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A chance? And only fifty million? Glenmede doesn't expect earnings will reach new highs until the second half of twenty twenty one. That's a year away, if we're lucky.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Glenmede doesnt expect earnings will reach new highs until the second half of 2021, which the firm adds is not so coincidentally aligned with estimates for vaccine delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Still, 82% of economic activity lost due to mandates has been, uh, regained. That’s pretty remarkable progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, eighty two percent of economic activity lost due to mandates has been, uh, regained. That's pretty remarkable progress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, wealth management firm Glenmede said Monday that although it estimates 77% of economic activity lost due to social-distancing mandates has been regained, it only expects earnings will see a small rebound from an abysmal second quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Regained from, like, a standstill. And earnings are still looking at an abysmal second quarter rebound, just a small one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Regained from, like, a standstill. And earnings are still looking at an abysmal second quarter rebound, just a small one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Glenmede said Monday that although it estimates 77% of economic activity lost due to social-distancing mandates has been regained, it only expects earnings will see a small rebound from an abysmal second quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But it's all aligned with the vaccine! That's the key here. Normalization of the economy, it's just around the corner.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's all aligned with the vaccine! That's the key here. Normalization of the economy, it's just around the corner.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Around the corner? Morgan Stanley predicts a collapse in profit margins. And Goldman Sachs is talking about, um, a 21% fall in Q3 earnings for the S&P 500!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Around the corner? Morgan Stanley predicts a collapse in profit margins. And Goldman Sachs is talking about, um, a twenty one percent fall in Q3 earnings for the S&P five hundred!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Expect weak and uneven sales growth, and a collapse in profit margins, to characterize third-quarter results, Goldman Sachs said in a weekend note to clients...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's better than the 32% drop in Q2, though. It's improving, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's better than the thirty two percent drop in Q2, though. It's improving, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats how much Goldman said it expects third-quarter earnings per share will fall among S&P 500 firms, compared to a 32% drop in the second quarter and a 15% fall in the first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Improving? We've still got major pockets of the economy, like airlines, absolutely struggling. They need stimulus, like, yesterday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Improving? We've still got major pockets of the economy, like airlines, absolutely struggling. They need stimulus, like, yesterday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There are pockets of the economy that continue to struggle, and an additional round of fiscal stimulus could put the U.S. economy on a gentler and less painful path toward full recovery once a vaccine becomes widely available.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, obviously, but the market is, uh, watching JPMorgan and Citi for signs things are mending. That’s a hopeful sign.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, obviously, but the market is, uh, watching JPMorgan and Citi for signs things are mending. That's a hopeful sign.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any signs on Tuesday from JPMorgan and Citi that the economy is on the mend will help bank stocks and the overall market, says Marc Chaikin, founder of Philadelphia-based quant investment research firm Chaikin Analytics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hopeful? JPMorgan and Citigroup are the ones everyone's worried about! Financials are down 16% this year!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hopeful? JPMorgan and Citigroup are the ones everyone's worried about! Financials are down sixteen percent this year!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The worst-performing sectors are energy (down 36%) and financials (down 16%).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But technology is up 32%! Consumer discretionary up 23%! The market isn't uniform, it's just, uh, shifting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But technology is up thirty two percent! Consumer discretionary up twenty three percent! The market isn't uniform, it's just, uh, shifting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best-performing sectors this year, as tracked by S&P 500 ETFs through Fridays close, include technology (up 32%), consumer discretionary (up 23%) and communications (up 13%).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Shifting, you mean, like, away from entire industries that employ millions of people? Energy is down 36%, like, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shifting, you mean, like, away from entire industries that employ millions of people? Energy is down thirty six percent, like, come on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The worst-performing sectors are energy (down 36%) and financials (down 16%).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: We're on a path, though. The vaccine will change everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: We're on a path, though. The vaccine will change everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A path to what? More struggling sectors and, um, hoping for a magic bullet?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A path to what? More struggling sectors and, um, hoping for a magic bullet?
